title: char set order
content:
Im a newby in font design, one thing ive never understood was all those diff caracter sets and the differences between the mac and pc platform, hopefully now opentype fonts are out and things are made more simple. Is there a way to be able to see the full set of typefaces of an opentype, true type, type1 font so when the time comes to create my own, to put them in the right order!  
Am i making sense?

 [‹ Hints, Sidebearings, and a theory](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808061756/http:/typophile.com/node/18525 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font Organizanization ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808061756/http:/typophile.com/node/18771 "Go to next forum topic")
author: zoran

comments.content:
Typo.cz – Special Characters and Unicode  
 [http://www.typo.cz/euro/\_typo/typo-unicode.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808061756/http:/www.typo.cz/euro/_typo/typo-unicode.html "http://www.typo.cz/euro/\_typo/typo-unicode.html")

Adobe Glyph List for New Fonts  
 [http://partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/opentype/aglfn13.txt](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808061756/http:/partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/opentype/aglfn13.txt "http://partners.adobe.com/public/developer/en/opentype/aglfn13.txt")

BTW only one problem with link no. 1 (Typo.cz – Special Characters and Unicode):

Unicode -\> Recommended links -\> Microsoft Typography:

Well prepared site about new font format OpenType, standard Unicode and other font related information. Links to many typographical sources.”

I don’t see that, but:

THIS WEBSITE IS NOT ENDORSED BY OR AFFILIATED WITH THE U.S. SOCIAL SECURITY ADMINISTRATION OR ANY GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY.

This website is being redeveloped  
and is currently under contruction
